chapter.title: Migration Guide
chapter.para: This section provides helpful information on incompatible chanes between versions.

formalpara.title: AnnotationFactory.createAnnotation()
formalpara.para: No longer throws UIMAExcption. If this exception was cought, some IDEs may complete here after upgrading to uimaFIT 2.1.0.

section.title: Version 1.4.0 to 2.0.0

formalpara.title: Backwards compatibility
formalpara.para: Compatibility with legacy annotation is provided by the Legacy support module.

formalpara.title: Change of Maven groupId and artifactId
formalpara.para: The Maven group ID has changed from org.uimafit to org.apache.uima.

section.para: The artifact ID of the main uimaFIT artifact has been changed from uimafit to uimafit-core.

formalpara.title: Change of package names
formalpara.para: The base package has been renamed from org.uimafit to org.apache.uima.fit. A global search/replace on Java files with for lines starting with import org.uimafit and replacing that with import org.apache.uima.fit should work.

formalpara.title: @ConfigurationParameter
formalpara.para: The default value for the mandatory attribute now is true. The default name of configuration parameters is now the name of the annotated field only. The classname is no longer prefixed. The method ConfigurationParameterFactory.createConfigurationParameterName() that was used to generate the prefixed name has been removed.

formalpara.title: Type detection: META-INF/org.uimafit folder
formalpara.para: The META-INF/org.uimafit was renamed to META-INF/org.apache.uima.fit.

formalpara.title: JCasUtil
formalpara.para: The deprecated JCasUtil.iterate() methods have been removed. JCasUtil.select() should be used instead.

formalpara.title: AnalysisEngineFactory
formalpara.para: All createAggregateXXX and createPrimitiveXXX methods have been renamed to createEngineXXX. The old names are deprecated and will be removed in future versions.

section.para: All createAnalysisEngineXXX methods have been renamed to createEngineXXX. The old names are deprecated and will be removed in future versions.

formalpara.title: CollectionReaderFactory
formalpara.para: All createDescriptionXXX methods have been renamed to createReaderDescriptionXXX. The old names are deprecated and will be removed in future versions.

section.para: All createCollectionReaderXXX methods have been renamed to createReaderXXX. The old names are deprecated and will be removed in future versions.

formalpara.title: JCasIterable
formalpara.para: JCasIterable now only accepts reader and engine descriptions (no instances) and no longer implements the Iterator interface. Instead, new JCasIterator has been added, which replaces JCasIterable in that respect.

formalpara.title: CpePipeline
formalpara.para: CpePipeline has been moved to a separate module with the artifact ID uimafit-cpe to reduce the dependencies incurred by the main uimaFIT artifact.

formalpara.title: XWriter removed
formalpara.para: The XWriter and associated file namers have been removed as they were much more complex then acutally needed. As an alternative, CasIOUtil has been introduced providing several convenience methods to read/write JCas/CAS data.

formalpara.title: JCasFactory
formalpara.para: Methods only loading JCas data have been removed from JCasFactory. The new methods in CasIOUtil can be used instead.

section.title: Legacy support module
section.para: The compatibility layer should allow you to migrate to uimaFIT without breaking anything. You should then be able to gradually change the codebase to be compatible with uimaFIT . As far as my tests go, uimaFIT 1.x and can coexist peacefully on the classpath (and indeed both need to be on the classpath in order to use the legacy support module).
To enable the legacy support, make sure that you have a dependency on uimaFIT 1.x and then just add a dependency on the legacy module:
uimaFIT automatically detects the presence of the legacy module and uses it - no additional configuration is necessary.
